CAREER SUMMARY  
 
August 2019 to date  ExxonMobil, Global Research;  Brussels, Belgium  
 
January 2022 to date  
Position:  Senior Research Engineer  
 
August 2019 to December 2021  
Research Engineer  
 
Tasks: Responsible for planning, managing and executing all aspects of research 
and process development projects. Specifically, conducting fundamental and applied 
research on heterogeneous and homogeneous catalysts, adsorbents, and catal ytic 
processes, such as new chemical transformation to upgrade hydrocarbon 
feedstocks. He is  a member of research teams that span multiple regions (Americas, 
EU, Asia) that are composed of interdisciplinary members (chemists, engineers, 
business, marketing) . As an example of a research project, please see press release 
https://lnkd.in/euz -9hAP (catalyst and process development for propane 
dehydrogenation technologies).  
 
Other tasks include: managing a group of approx. seven research technicians (MSc, 
BSc) on laboratory experimentation, spectroscopy and chromatography data 
    
collection, troubleshooting and SHE related training. Responsible for purchases of 
equipment and third party services, HAZOP assessments and post -implementation 
(training, method setup).  
 
March 2017 to March 2019  Grillo -Werke AG, R&D Department, Chemical 
Division  Duisburg, Germany  
Position:  Research Chemist  
Tasks: Study of the sulfonation of methane to methanesulfonic acid and recycling of 
fluorocarbons under superacid conditions; scale -up process to  a pilot plant setting; 
handle corrosive and explosive mixtures; prepare patents and scientific publications.  
 
March 2016 – March 2017  Hopperide Inc.; Ottawa, Canada  
Position: Start -up Co -founder  
Tasks: Implementation from zero -to-one of every aspect of a technol ogical start -up; 
business development, software coding, financing, customer engagement, etc.  
 
 
COMMENT  
 
 
Core Competencies  
• Managing complex research projects (ideation, prioritization, execution), 
translating vision from business into research solutions, intellectua l property 
drafting, pilot plant construction and operation (eg., reactors up to 4 gallons, 
120 barg, and 7.5 m distillation columns).  
• Managing and training laboratory technicians in air -sensitive techniques, high -
throughput techniques, pressure reactors, vacuum distillations, handling highly 
corrosive and explosive mixtures, reporting out data, and SHE trainings for 
nobody gets hurt policy.  
• Expertise in data acquisition and interpretation of homogeneous and 
heterogeneous catalyst characterization (X -ray di ffraction, NMR, FT -IR, BET, 
SEM, TEM, etc), and catalytic process development and optimization (online 
GC, HPLC, NMR, etc).  
• Inventor on eight patent applications and author of eight peer -reviewed 
publications. Over twenty three international conference pre sentations.
